articles.author: Beth Mole
articles.title: More children gain hearing as gene therapy for profound deafness advances - Ars Technica
articles.description: The therapy treats a rare type of deafness, but experts hope it's a "jumping point."
articles.content: Enlarge/ Opal Sandy (center), who was born completely deaf because of a rare genetic condition, can now hear unaided for the first time after receiving gene therapy at 11-months-old. She is shown wit… [+4428 chars]

articles.author: Jijo Malayil
articles.title: MIT's new AI tech could make limbless, slimy, squishy robots a reality - Interesting Engineering
articles.description: A novel algorithm enables robots to flexibly squish, bend, or stretch for tasks such as obstacle avoidance or item retrieval.
articles.content: Each task is designed to represent certain properties that we deem important, such as the ability to navigate through long-horizon explorations, analyze the environment, and interact with external ob… [+1862 chars]
